meanings.definition: To plagiarize or steal someone else's work.
meanings.sent1: He cribbed his friend's essay and turned it in as his own.
meanings.sent2: The student was caught cribbing from an online article for his assignment.
meanings.sent3: The parrot cribbed the tune of a popular song and sang it all day.
meanings.sent4: The artist cribbed the design of the painting from a famous masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: She cribbed the recipe for the delicious cake and claimed it as her own creation.

meanings.definition: To confine or restrict someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The baby was cribbed in a playpen to keep him safe.
meanings.sent2: The construction site was cribbed off to prevent unauthorized access.
meanings.sent3: The cat cribbed itself under the bed during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent4: The garden was cribbed by a fence to protect the flowers from animals.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was cribbed in a hidden cave, waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: To copy or imitate something, especially in a dishonest way.
meanings.sent1: The student cribbed the answers from his classmate during the test.
meanings.sent2: The designer was accused of cribbing the fashion collection from a smaller brand.
meanings.sent3: The comedian cribbed the jokes from an old comedy show without giving credit.
meanings.sent4: The company cribbed the logo of a well-known brand for their own products.
meanings.sent5: The author cribbed the plot of the novel from a famous book series.
